interfaces.kernel

Interface JCL_facade


  • public interface JCL_facade
    Version:
    1.0 This class represents a JCL facade for HPC requirements. There are facades for IoT demands and for capacity planning.
    Author:
    JCL Team

    • Method Detail

      • register

        boolean register(java.lang.Class<?> serviceClass,
                 java.lang.String nickName)
        Registers a class on JCL, so it can be executed later.
        Parameters:
        serviceClass - - The class to be executed remotely
        nickName - - The class name to be used by JCL
        Returns:
        true if it is registered, false otherwise
        See Also:
        register(File[] jars, String classToBeExecuted)

      • register

        boolean register(java.io.File[] jars,
                 java.lang.String nickName)
        Registers an array of JAR files. The first JAR file must contain the class to be executed later with JCL. The remaining JAR files represent the dependability, i.e. libraries or third part JARs
        Parameters:
        jars - - The array of jars files necessary to execute a class remotely. The first jar file is the user application. The remaining are dependencies.
        nickName - - The class name to be used by JCL. It must be the same name of the class (without suffix .class or .java). The class package is not necessary in nickname.
        Returns:
        true if it is registered, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        register(Class, String)

      • unRegister

        boolean unRegister(java.lang.String nickName)
        Unregisters a class using its nickname. No mater if the class is registered via method register (Class serviceClass, String nickName) or method register (File[] jars, String nickName)
        Parameters:
        nickName - - Class name defined by the developer in register phase. register(Class, String) register(File[], String)
        Returns:
        true if it is removed, false otherwise.

      • execute

        java.util.concurrent.Future<JCL_result> execute(java.lang.String nickName,
                                                java.lang.Object... args)
        Executes the class method ("execute") from the class registered before. The method is executed remotely in JCL Pacu version or locally in Lambari version. It is an asynchronous call. IMPORTANT: the register method must be called before an execution The class to be executed must have the "execute" method inside
        Parameters:
        nickName - - Class name defined by the developer in register phase. register(Class, String) register(File[], String)
        args - - The method parameters
        Returns:
        the task id, used to get the execution result asynchronously (Future.get() or future.get(time)).
        See Also:
        execute(String, String, Object... args)

      • execute

        java.util.concurrent.Future<JCL_result> execute(java.lang.String nickName,
                                                java.lang.String methodName,
                                                java.lang.Object... args)
        Executes a specific method of a class registered before. The method is executed remotely in JCL Pacu version or locally in Lambari version. It is an asynchronous call.
        Parameters:
        nickName - - Class name defined by the developer in register phase. register(Class, String) register(File[], String)
        methodName - - The class method name to be executed.
        args - - The method parameters.
        Returns:
        The task id, used to get the result asynchronously (Future.get() or future.get(time)).
        See Also:
        execute(String, Object...), Future for a better understanding

      • getAllResultBlocking

        java.util.List<JCL_result> getAllResultBlocking(java.util.List<java.util.concurrent.Future<JCL_result>> tickets)
        Gets a list of results (JCL_result) from a list of previous submitted tasks The caller blocks until all results are returned. If an exceptions occurs, JCL encapsulates it in JCL_result. In summary, all correct results or exceptions must be returned before continue.
        Parameters:
        tickets - - list of previous submitted tasks identifications
        Returns:
        a list of results, including execution exceptions.
        See Also:
        for a better understanding

      • getAllResultUnblocking

        java.util.List<JCL_result> getAllResultUnblocking(java.util.List<java.util.concurrent.Future<JCL_result>> tickets)
        Gets a list of results (JCL_result) from a list of previous submitted tasks The caller is not blocked, so there is an option of NULLs in the result. If an exceptions occurs, JCL encapsulates it in JCL_result. In summary, all correct results or exceptions or NULLs must be returned before continue. It is a non-blocking call, very useful to check if a result is ready without blocking the caller.
        Parameters:
        tickets - - list of previous submitted tasks identifications
        Returns:
        a list of results, including execution exceptions and NULLs.
        See Also:
        for a better understanding, for a blocking call

      • removeResult

        JCL_result removeResult(java.util.concurrent.Future<JCL_result> ticket)
        Removes a result from the JCL. Must be called to avoid garbage in JCL.
        Parameters:
        ticket - - The task name or the task id in asynchronous executions
        Returns:
        the removed result (encapsulated in JCL_result) or NULL if there is no result.

      • instantiateGlobalVar

        boolean instantiateGlobalVar(java.lang.Object key,
                             java.lang.String className,
                             java.io.File[] jars,
                             java.lang.Object[] args)
        Creates a global variable with a user defined key. The class adopted to instantiate the global variable must be informed (className). All JAR files, including the dependencies, must be added to enable correct instantiations. Finally, the arguments adopted to instantiate the global variable (args). Note that, args can be NULL. IMPORTANT: It is a synchronous call. JCL also enables asynchronous instantiations. IMPORTANT: The className must be equal to the .class file in the first JAR file of "jars" argument.
        Parameters:
        key - - The variable identifier.
        className - - the name of the global variable class. It must be equal to the .class file in the first JAR file of "jars" argument.
        jars - - JARs files used to instantiate the global variable. The first JAR file includes the global variable class file. The remaining JAR files are dependencies.
        args - - the arguments adopted by the constructor of the global variable. It can be NULL.
        Returns:
        Return true if the variable is created. false otherwise.
        See Also:
        instantiateGlobalVar(Object key, Object instance), deleteGlobalVar(Object key)

      • instantiateGlobalVar

        boolean instantiateGlobalVar(java.lang.Object key,
                             java.lang.Object instance)
        Stores a previous instantiated object (instance) in JCL with a user defined nickname (key) This method works only with Java types, since there is no user type to be registered. IMPORTANT: It is a synchronous call. JCL also enables asynchronous instantiations.
        Parameters:
        key - - The variable identifier.
        instance - - An instance of the variable
        Returns:
        Return true if the variable is registered. False otherwise.
        See Also:
        instantiateGlobalVar(Object key, String varName, File[] jars, Object[] args), deleteGlobalVar(Object key)

      • deleteGlobalVar

        boolean deleteGlobalVar(java.lang.Object key)
        Removes a user global variable from JCL. If the variable is previously locked, the delete will return false. The user must unlock first and then delete the global variable.
        Parameters:
        key - - The variable identifier
        Returns:
        Return true if the variable is deleted. False otherwise.
        See Also:
        instantiateGlobalVar(Object key, String varName, File[] jars, Object[] defaultVarValue), instantiateGlobalVar(Object key, Object instance)

      • setValueUnlocking

        boolean setValueUnlocking(java.lang.Object key,
                          java.lang.Object value)
        Updates a global variable with a new value. It also unlocks the variable access if it is previously locked.
        Parameters:
        key - - The variable identifier
        value - - The global variable new value
        Returns:
        True if value is correctly updated and unlocked or false otherwise

      • getValue

        JCL_result getValue(java.lang.Object key)
        Gets a variable value from JCL. It does not lock de global variable
        Parameters:
        key - - The variable identifier
        Returns:
        The global variable value or an error or null if no variable exists
        See Also:
        for a locked call

      • getValueLocking

        JCL_result getValueLocking(java.lang.Object key)
        Gets a variable varName value and locks its access. This is a simple implementation of critical sections. The variable is locked by a single process until a setValueUnlocking(Object key, Object) call occurs. Other processes can only read such a variable value, using JCL getValue(Object key) method
        Parameters:
        key - - The variable identifier
        Returns:
        The global variable value or an error or null if no variable exists. The pair getValueLocking and setValueUnlocking implements critical sections in JCL.
        See Also:
        for an unlocked call

      • destroy

        void destroy()
        destroy JCL_User classes. Adopted at the end of a JCL program.

      • containsTask

        boolean containsTask(java.lang.String nickName)
        Verify if there is a task registered in JCL.
        Parameters:
        nickName - the task identifier.
        Returns:
        true if JCL contains such a task, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        containsGlobalVar(Object key)

      • containsGlobalVar

        boolean containsGlobalVar(java.lang.Object key)
        Verify if there is a global variable registered in JCL
        Parameters:
        key - - The variable identifier.
        Returns:
        True if JCL contains such a global variable, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        containsTask(String)

      • isLock

        boolean isLock(java.lang.Object key)
        Verify if the global variable is locked, without locking it. It is different from a getValueLocking(Object) call, which locks a variable access until a #setValueLocking(Object, Object) call occurs.
        Parameters:
        key - - The variable identifier.
        Returns:
        return true if global variable is locked or false otherwise.

      • cleanEnvironment

        boolean cleanEnvironment()
        Clean all global variables and all results from submitted tasks from JCL.
        Returns:
        return true if all Host and Server components were cleaned or false otherwise.

      • executeAll

        java.util.List<java.util.concurrent.Future<JCL_result>> executeAll(java.lang.String nickName,
                                                                   java.lang.Object... args)
        Execute the method named "execute" in all Hosts of a JCL. The same arguments args are adopted in each Host. Just one task per Host in this method
        Parameters:
        nickName - - The object nickname
        args - - The method parameters values used in all Host calls
        Returns:
        A list of Future objects to get all the results asynchronously.
        See Also:
        for an execution per core of JCL

      • executeAll

        java.util.List<java.util.concurrent.Future<JCL_result>> executeAll(java.lang.String nickName,
                                                                   java.lang.Object[][] args)
        Execute the method named "execute" in all Hosts of a JCL. Different arguments args are adopted in each Host. Just one task per Host in this method
        Parameters:
        nickName - - The object nickname
        args - - The method parameters values used in all Host calls
        Returns:
        A list of Future objects to get all the results asynchronously.
        See Also:
        for an execution per core of JCL

      • executeAllCores

        java.util.List<java.util.concurrent.Future<JCL_result>> executeAllCores(java.lang.String nickName,
                                                                        java.lang.String methodName,
                                                                        java.lang.Object... args)
        Execute a specific method in all cores of all Hosts of a JCL. The same arguments args are adopted in each core of each Host.
        Parameters:
        nickName - - The object nickname
        methodName - - The method name
        args - - The method parameters values used in all calls
        Returns:
        A list of Future objects to get all the results asynchronously.
        See Also:
        for an execution per Host of JCL

      • executeAllCores

        java.util.List<java.util.concurrent.Future<JCL_result>> executeAllCores(java.lang.String nickName,
                                                                        java.lang.Object... args)
        Execute the method named "execute" in all cores of all Hosts of a JCL. The same arguments args are adopted in each Host. Just one task per Host core in this method
        Parameters:
        nickName - - The object nickname
        args - - The method parameters values used in all calls
        Returns:
        A list of Future objects to get all the results asynchronously.
        See Also:
        for an execution per Host of JCL

      • executeAllCores

        java.util.List<java.util.concurrent.Future<JCL_result>> executeAllCores(java.lang.String nickName,
                                                                        java.lang.Object[][] args)
        Execute the method named "execute" in all cores of all Hosts of a JCL. A different argument args is adopted in each core of each Host. Just one task per core in this method
        Parameters:
        nickName - - The object nickname
        args - - The method parameters values used in all calls
        Returns:
        A list of Future objects to get all the results asynchronously.
        See Also:
        for an execution per Host of JCL

      • getDevices

        <T extends java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> java.util.List<T> getDevices()
        Returns a list with all "high-end" devices in the JCL cluster. "High-end" devices are devices that can do storage and general purpose computing. Sensing activities are classified in JCL by IoT devices
        Returns:
        a list with all "high-end" devices in the cluster
        See Also:
        to get devices that handle sensing activities

      • getDeviceCore

        int getDeviceCore(java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> device)
        The number of cores of a specified Host or High-end device, i.e. devices that do no sensing.
        Parameters:
        device - - the specified device Format: Entry of "alias name , HOSTIDIPPORT".
        Returns:
        the number of cores.
        See Also:
        getDevices()

      • getAllDevicesCores

        <T extends java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> java.util.Map<T,java.lang.Integer> getAllDevicesCores()
        Get a list of registered "high-end" devices or Hosts number of cores. Format: Entry of "alias name , HOSTIDIPPORT", "number of cores"
        Returns:
        The Map with Host as key and number of cores as value.
        See Also:
        getDevices()

      • getClusterCores

        int getClusterCores()
        Get the number of cores in the JCL cluster. In Lambari version, it returns the number of cores of the local machine
        Returns:
        number of cores in the cluster.

      • instantiateGlobalVarOnDevice

        boolean instantiateGlobalVarOnDevice(java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> device,
                                     java.lang.Object key,
                                     java.lang.String className,
                                     java.io.File[] jars,
                                     java.lang.Object[] args)
        Creates a global variable with a user defined key in a specific Host. The class adopted to instantiate the global variable must be informed (className). All JAR files, including the dependencies, must be added to enable correct instantiations. Finally, the arguments adopted to instantiate the global variable (args). Note that, args can be NULL. IMPORTANT: It is a synchronous call. JCL also enables asynchronous instantiations. IMPORTANT: The className must be equal to the .class file in the first JAR file of "jars" argument.
        Parameters:
        device - - Entry of "alias name , HOSTIDIPPORT".
        key - - The variable identifier.
        className - - the name of the global variable class. It must be equal to the .class file in the first JAR file of "jars" argument.
        jars - - JARs files used to instantiate the global variable. The first JAR file includes the global variable class file. The remaining JAR files are dependencies.
        args - - the arguments adopted by the constructor of the global variable. It can be NULL.
        Returns:
        Return true if the variable is created. false otherwise.
        See Also:
        instantiateGlobalVar(Object, Object), deleteGlobalVar(Object)

      • instantiateGlobalVarOnDevice

        boolean instantiateGlobalVarOnDevice(java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> device,
                                     java.lang.Object key,
                                     java.lang.Object instance)
        Stores a previous instantiated object (instance) in JCL with a user defined nickname (key) and in a specific Host This method works only with Java types, since there is no user type to be registered. IMPORTANT: It is a synchronous call. JCL also enables asynchronous instantiations.
        Parameters:
        device - - Entry of "alias name , HOSTIDIPPORT".
        key - - The variable identifier.
        instance - - An instance of the variable
        Returns:
        Return true if the variable is registered. False otherwise.
        See Also:
        instantiateGlobalVar(Object, String, File[], Object[]), deleteGlobalVar(Object)

      • instantiateGlobalVarAsy

                                                                       java.lang.Object instance)
        Stores a previous instantiated object (instance) in JCL with a user defined nickname (key) This method works only with Java types, since there is no user type to be registered. IMPORTANT: It is an synchronous call. JCL also enables synchronous instantiations.
        Parameters:
        key - - The variable identifier.
        instance - - An instance of the variable
        Returns:
        Return true if the variable is registered. False otherwise.
        See Also:
        instantiateGlobalVarAsy(Object, String, File[], Object[]), deleteGlobalVar(Object)

      • instantiateGlobalVarAsy

        java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Boolean> instantiateGlobalVarAsy(java.lang.Object key,
                                                                       java.lang.String className,
                                                                       java.io.File[] jars,
                                                                       java.lang.Object[] args)
        Creates a global variable with a user defined key. The class adopted to instantiate the global variable must be informed (className). All JAR files, including the dependencies, must be added to enable correct instantiations. Finally, the arguments adopted to instantiate the global variable (args). Note that, args can be NULL. IMPORTANT: It is an asynchronous call. JCL also enables synchronous instantiations. IMPORTANT: The className must be equal to the .class file in the first JAR file of "jars" argument.
        Parameters:
        key - - The variable identifier.
        className - - the name of the global variable class. It must be equal to the .class file in the first JAR file of "jars" argument.
        jars - - JARs files used to instantiate the global variable. The first JAR file includes the global variable class file. The remaining JAR files are dependencies.
        args - - the arguments adopted by the constructor of the global variable. It can be NULL.
        Returns:
        Return true if the variable is created. false otherwise.
        See Also:
        instantiateGlobalVarAsy(Object, Object), deleteGlobalVar(Object)

      • executeOnDevice

        java.util.concurrent.Future<JCL_result> executeOnDevice(java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> device,
                                                        java.lang.String registerClass,
                                                        java.lang.String methodName,
                                                        java.lang.Object... args)
        Executes a method named "methodName" in a specific device or Host. The method arguments are represented by args
        Parameters:
        device - - Entry of "alias name , HOSTIDIPPORT". getDevices()
        key - - The object nickname defined by the developer in register
        methodName - - The name of the method to be executed
        args - - The method parameters values
        Returns:
        a Future object to get the result asynchronously.
        See Also:
        for more details about how JCL encapsulates error and correct results

      • executeOnDevice

                                                        java.lang.String registerClass,
                                                        java.lang.Object... args)

        args - - The method parameters values
        Returns:
        a Future object to get the result asynchronously.
        See Also:
        for more details about how JCL encapsulates error and correct results

      • getDeviceMetadata

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getDeviceMetadata(java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> device)
        retrieves all information about a device configuration
        Parameters:
        device - - The device to collect the metadata
        Returns:
        a Map with all the metadata of the device

      • setDeviceMetadata

        boolean setDeviceMetadata(java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> device,
                          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> metadata)
        Configures a device according to a metadata
        Parameters:
        device - - The device to set the metadata
        metadata - - The metadata to configure the device
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if the metadata was configured at the device or not
